result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Andrle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other sentence currently being served.

Fine/Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment conditions as noted above for the fine/costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: SDCNI letter returned: Return to Sender, Refused, Unable to Forward. Inmate Not here/Released. se

Case called @ 11:17AM: Defendant David J Andrle in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for David J Andrle.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. No statement by DE. Court orders $250 fine plus costs with 60 DTP or PP. 5 day Jail sentence concurrent with any other sentence.

Case called @ 3:06 PM Defendant David J Andrle appeared by video, in custody at RGCI. Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow appeared in court for David J Andrle. Attorney Dennis Ryan appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his right to be personally present in the courtroom. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. NGP entered. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.
